intro: Phacelia cicutaria var. cicutaria, commonly known as the narrowleaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and grasslands, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is also noted for its role in supporting pollinators and its use in ecological restoration projects.
